text: coarse bubbeled head, hazy brown color, fresh hoppy aroma (pineapple), same in flavour with subtle malt-notes, distinct high-quality bitterness
0,33l bought in Vienna beer store. Decent ?Altbayrisch Dunkel?. Nothing to fancy. Would drink again but not something Id recommended someone whos new to craft and special beers.
300ml at Craftfest, Feldkirch. Aroma is coffee. Appearance is dark, cloudy amber with a fine brown-ish foam. Taste is light sweet, medium bitter. Very nice balanced. Great.

330 ml bottle. Pours dark red-brown with a light brown head. Aroma is malty with grassy hops and hints of citric fruits. Medium body with pleasant carbonation. Flavor is surprising and in contrast to the smell distinctly sweet and slightly acidic and heavily of roasted malt and mild coffee. Very nice beer

Many thanks to Erzengel for sharing!

Pours dark reddish brown colour with a huge most good lasting tan head. aroma of dark roasted malt, caramel. Taste of dark roasted malt, caramel, vanilla, some coffee, good stuff!

Many thanks to Werckmeister for this bottle! Roasted bitter beginning. The beer is intense roasted, not too dry with hints of burned caramel. Smooth with and intense roasted-bitter background, not much hops there. The aftertaste is black burned caramel with hints of brown sugar in a very drinkable combination. Great stuff!

330ml bottle, from trade with das Werckmeister. Many thanks. Pours hazy brown, medium beige head. Nice caramelised malt aroma, some cocoa. Taste is caramel, light dark fruits, some earth but largely very smooth and goes down very quick indeed. Another please.

Bottle from Beer Store Vienna:Aroma is malty, roasty. Reddish color, light brownish head. Flavor is malty, roasty, light note of chocolate, toffee, shy fruitiness. Roasty, light bitter finish. Nice, but more complex flavor then aroma.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2016 First Rating 21.09.2015: 330ml bottle at home courtesy Saeglopur, many thanks. BB 15.10.2015. brown hazy color, small tan head. smells of plums, sweetness, spices, honey, oranges. light to medium body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes citric, spices, some fruits, plums, oranges, grains, herbs. finishes light dry, with plums and citric notes. decent one. 6/4/6/3/13: 3.2
Rerate: 0,33l from tap at Ottakringer Braukulturwochen, brown hazy colour, small tan head. light caramel, spices, tobacco. medium body, soft carbonation slick mouthfeel. tastes of caramel,  spices, lightly roasted, lightly fruity, plums. finishes lightly roasty with notes of plums and spices. quite good one, especially the taste is very nice, good one.

330 ml bottle bought at the brewery.
Deep copper, hazy body, with a big, stable, frothy, lacing, beige head.
Aroma of caramel, dark fruits, toast, bread, some hops.
Tastes of toast, dark and dried fruits, bread, some caramel, some citric hops.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes roasty, toasty, bready, a bit fruity, a bit hoppy.

Really nice. Fortunately not as sweet as many Dunkels from Austria, with a good balance between toasty, fruity and sweet notes. Refreshing and easy, despite the roast notes.

Der Name Rotglut passt wie die Faust aufs Auge für das kupferfarbene Bier. Es riecht aber nicht wie ein Dunkelbier sondern wie ein Rotbier und so schmeckt es auch. Etwas würzig nach Karamellmalz, starke Röstaromen vermischt mit starker Hopfenherbe. Auch Noten von dunkler Brotkruste und Dunkelbrot sind dabei, die kommen vom Roggenmalz. Die Bezeichnung Altbayisch Dunkel ist hier irreführend. Das kann man gut mit dem Ratsherrn Rotbier oder dem Bier4Wedding Rotbiervergleichen und keinesfalls mit einem bayrischen Dunklen. Trotzdem bleibt es ein interessantes und gutes Roggen-Rotbier.

Bottle. Dark amber body with off-white head. Aroma malts with some caramel and hints of grains. Taste is a little bit thin but there is some roasted malts with hints of coffee. Aftertaste is malty with not to strong hop bitterness. O.K.
